issues.summary: [Funnel/Plans] Integrate OTP Banner logic and data fetching
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
h3. Description

Implement the business logic and data integration for the One-Time Purchase (OTP) banner component. This includes fetching user's upcoming OTP orders, determining when to show the banner, and handling the navigation to order details.

*Related UI Ticket:* GOC-3377 - [Funnel/Plans] Create OTP Banner/Entrypoint component

*Data Requirements:*

* Fetch user's upcoming one-time purchases using existing {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook
* Determine if user has any upcoming OTP deliveries
* Get order details (order ID, delivery date, order status)
* Handle loading, error, and empty states

*Business Logic:*

* Show banner only if user has an upcoming OTP order
* Banner should appear on funnel/plans and checkout pages (Delivery page and Payment page)
* Handle click navigation to OTP dashboard page
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#eae6ff}
h3. üîß Technical Implementation Details

*Existing Hook to Use:*

* *File:* {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}}
* *Hook:* {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}}
* This hook already fetches the user's one-time orders - use this instead of creating new API calls

*Implementation Steps:*

# Import and use {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook in the funnel/plans page component
# Pass the relevant order data as props to the OTP Banner UI component (from GOC-3377)
# Implement conditional rendering - only show banner if upcoming orders exist
# Ensure proper integration with UI component props from [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3377|smart-link]
{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
h3. Acceptance Criteria

h3. ‚úÖ AC1: Data Fetching & State Management

* Uses {{useCustomerOneTimeOrders}} hook from {{app/data-access/customer-orders/one-time-orders.ts}} to fetch OTP orders
* Correctly identifies if user has upcoming one-time purchase
* Handles loading state while fetching data (shows loading indicator or hides banner)
* Handles error state if hook returns

issues.summary: Hide the payment banner for the C@C flow

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h2. Clarifying Questions for Implementation Planning

Based on analysis of the codebase and the ticket requirements, I have the following questions:

*1. Which experiment determines banner visibility?*
The ticket references the {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} Statsig experiment. I found two related experiments in the codebase:

* {{mr_one_time_purchase_mvp}} (used in plans flow, returns {{isControl}} boolean)
* {{mr_charge_at_checkout}} (used in payment page, returns {{shouldPerformCharge}})

Which

comments.author: Alexander Matlin
comments.body:
h1. Implementation Specification: Hide PaymentAnxietyBanner for C@C Flow

h2. Goal

Hide the {{PaymentAnxietyBanner}} component on the {{/checkout/payment}} page when a customer is allocated to the Charge at Checkout (C@C) experiment variation. This is a temporary experiment that may need to be rolled back.

h2. User Stories

* As a customer in the C@C experiment variation, I should not see the payment anxiety banner on the checkout payment page
* As a customer in the control group (BAU), I shou

issues.summary: Coach Marks should not appear on Settings
issues.description:
*Coachmarks* is a user onboarding and guidance system that displays contextual tooltips, dialogs, and nudges to help users understand new features or navigate through important parts of the application. It's essentially an interactive tutorial system that guides users through key workflows.



However, as a customer if I login for first time on Settings, I will see the functionality appearing which does not make sense here given it should appear on Dashboard.

*AC:*

* Coach Mark should appear only on dashboard

*Steps to reproduce the error*:

!image-20250819-131409.png|width=3680,height=2382,alt="image-20250819-131409.png"!

!image-20250819-153106.png|width=1148,height=822,alt="image-20250819-153106.png"!



# Go the staging environment
## [https://www-staging.factor75.com/factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers|https://www-staging.factor75.com/factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers]
# Login in /factorform with a customer that have both memberships (factor && factorform)
## [edwin+sub@hellofresh.ca|mailto:edwin+sub@hellofresh.ca]
## factor1Test$
# Quickly go to /factorform/settings/gifts-and-offers
# Here the coach mark will appear

*How to fix it?*

* Review if we can implement a validation that checks the path and it does not contain settings

[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/31f0e1846bd0da21055519e74179cb8e468824d1/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/dialogs/WelcomeToFactorFormDialog.tsx#L19|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/31f0e1846bd0da21055519e74179cb8e468824d1/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/dialogs/WelcomeToFactorFormDialog.tsx#L19] 

[https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/497d93386b094f1cd8aec584ed52b8b1d88a7414/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-web/packages/components/sub-brand-coachmarks/CoachmarksProvider.tsx#L20|https://github.com/hellofresh/web/blob/497d93386b094f1cd8aec584ed52b8b1d88a7414/app/spaces/whitelabel/modules/whitelabel-we

issues.summary: [cls-dev-tools] Create CLI to run modules in sequence
issues.description:
We need to run modules in {{cls-dev-tools/customer-migration}} in the following order:

# Create a new customer [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-85|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-85|smart-link] 
# Create a new customer address [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-86|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-86|smart-link] 
# Create a new subscription and plan [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-88|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/MIO-88|smart-link]

issues.summary: Investigate Endless Pause capabilities
issues.description: Until week 8, menus will be hidden and migrated customers need to be paused for X weeks. We would like to be able to pause customers for a period of time. I believe in cross selling the default {{cadence_interval}} was 16 weeks using legacy endless pause under the hood. In Xsell customers were able to manually unpause a week at any time.

comments.author: Wanderley Teixeira
comments.body: [~accountid:605351403adeca0067e91c8e] Need to understand the capabilities to pause a subscription vs skip your weekly deliveries. I believe endless pause used in cross selling is skipping weeks up to that cadence_interval

comments.author: Liman Labaran
comments.body: In my investigation of the capabilities of pausing a subscription, initially tried the endless pause with API v2 {{subscriptions/{id}/endlessPause}} where i wanted to pause the subscription automatically, but that didn‚Äôt seem to be working, the PATCH endpoint has advertised by Hellofresh AI Chat seem to have been removed from access in API V2 [docs|https://api-v2-entry.staging-k8s.hellofresh.io/api-docs#!/subscriptions]. I got {{Forbidden: requests must go through deliveries-proxy}} when i tried

comments.author: Liman Labaran
comments.body: We will go with the skip subscription PATCH API v2 endpoint, skipping each HF week that is required.

comments.author: Wanderley Teixeira
comments.body: Yes, legacy endless pause is being deprecated. If we can use the new deliveries endpoint to skip those 3 weeks then we should be good. Thanks.

issues.summary: [Dashboard] Graduation Component Display
issues.description:
{panel:bgColor=#deebff}
*Description*
The graduation component will be shown on the OTP Dashboard for the following two scenarios,

# *As an OTP only customer* [Design|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=10968-40857&m=dev&focus-id=10968-37863]
# *As an OTP + Subscription customer (graduated customer)* [Design|https://www.figma.com/design/c8UzNBNmx0cG7DVkJPhNal/GoC--SBD-2302----GoC-OTP-v2?node-id=11215-79800&m=dev&focus-id=10968-37863]

The scope of this ticket is to enhance the static component created in [https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3214|https://hellofresh.atlassian.net/browse/GOC-3214|smart-link] to,
##  contain an error boundary,
##  dynamic content driven from contentful,
## CTA redirections,
### *OTP only customer* ‚Üí redirects to funnel /plans
### *OTP + Subscription* ‚Üí redirects to /my-deliveries

{panel}

{panel:bgColor=#e3fcef}
*Acceptance Criteria*

* Adds error boundary
* The benefits comes from contentful
* The CTA should,
** *OTP only customer* ‚Üí redirects to funnel /plans
** *OTP + Subscription* ‚Üí redirects to /my-deliveries
{panel}
